con:configuration.scriptText:
def expectedName = "Clark Kent"
def xmlObjResponse = new XmlSlurper().parseText(messageExchange.getResponseContent())
def actualName = xmlObjResponse.Body.GetHeroRealNameResponse.GetHeroRealNameResult
log.info actualName
assert actualName == expectedName , "actualName "+actualName+" Doesn't match expectedName "+expectedName

con:testCase.name: DataDriven GetHeroRealName TestCase

con:configuration.scriptText:
def expectedName = "Peter Parker"
def xmlObjResponse = new XmlSlurper().parseText(messageExchange.getResponseContent())
def actualName = xmlObjResponse.Body.GetHeroRealNameResponse.GetHeroRealNameResult
log.info actualName
assert actualName == expectedName , "actualName "+actualName+" Doesn't match expectedName "+expectedName

con:mockOperation.name: GetHeroRealName
GetHeroDetails
con:mockOperation.con:dispatchPath:
log.info "Mock for GetHeroDetails has been triggered"
def xmlObj=new XmlSlurper().parseText(mockRequest.requestContent) def alias def heroName = xmlObj.Body.GetHeroRealName.alias //log.info xmlObj log.info xmlObj.Body.GetHeroRealName.alias
log.info heroName.toString().toUpperCase() switch(heroName.toString().toUpperCase()) { case "SUPERMAN": log.info "Returning mock for "+heroName return "Superman" break case "SPIDERMAN": log.info "Returning mock for "+heroName return "Spiderman" break case "BATMAN": log.info "Returning mock for "+heroName return "Batman" break case "CAPTAIN AMERICA": log.info "Returning mock for "+heroName return "Captain America" break case "DAREDEVIL": log.info "Returning mock for "+heroName return "DareDevil" break case "INCREDIBLE HULK": log.info "Returning mock for "+heroName return "Incredible Hulk" break case "IRON MAN": log.info "Returning mock for "+heroName return "Iron Man" break case "FLASH": log.info "Returning mock for "+heroName return "Flash" break default: log.info "No Alias Found For Hero "+heroName+". Returning Default" return "Default" break
}

con:response.name: Superman
con:response.con:responseContent: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:tem="http://tempuri.org/"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> <!--Optional:--> <tem:GetHeroDetails> <tem:HeroName>Superman</tem:HeroName> <tem:RealName>Clark Kent</tem:RealName> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Mask</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Cape</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Flies</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>SuperStrength</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <Description>As his home planet crumbled his parents sent him into space. He landed on earth and was brought up by some decent folks out in the country. Because of the gravitational differences between his home planet and earth he now has super powers. Oh and something about ice and crystals . . .</Description> </tem:GetHeroDetails> </tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>

con:response.name: Spiderman
con:response.con:responseContent: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:tem="http://tempuri.org/"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> <!--Optional:--> <tem:GetHeroDetails> <tem:HeroName>Spiderman</tem:HeroName> <tem:RealName>Peter Parker</tem:RealName> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Mask</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Cape</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Flies</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>SuperStrength</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <Description>He was visiting some sort of research lab and he got bitten by some weird spider. This giving him spider like abilities one of which was not the ability to shoot web out of his hands. He made some sort of gadget to shoot web like substance up until some point where he was turned into a actual spider. When he was turned back from being a real life spider he then had the ability to shoot webs out of his hands. His parents where dead when he was much younger and then his uncle that raised him also died at some point</Description> </tem:GetHeroDetails> </tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>

con:response.name: Iron Man
con:response.con:responseContent: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:tem="http://tempuri.org/"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> <!--Optional:--> <tem:GetHeroDetails> <tem:HeroName>Iron Man</tem:HeroName> <tem:RealName>Tony Stark</tem:RealName> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Mask</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Cape</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Flies</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>SuperStrength</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <Description>Rich guy that made billions from fuelling wars and selling weapons to the highest bidder Tony was kidnapped and forced to build some sort of weapon. Instead he built some sort of iron man suit and armed with the iron man song by Black Sabbath he proceeded to escape. Once home he found that he liked wearing a metal suit so he built a better version and thus became iron man. Or is the suit iron man and he is just the soft chewy interior of the machine. If someone else jumped into the suit and ran around saving people would people call tony Iron man or the suit Iron man. Better yet say the suit had a mind of it's own and was flying around doing stuff would people yell oh look its Iron Man or would they say Oh look it's Iron mans suit? Wow thats deep . . .</Description> </tem:GetHeroDetails> </tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>

con:response.name: Captain America
con:response.con:responseContent: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:tem="http://tempuri.org/"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> <!--Optional:--> <tem:GetHeroDetails> <tem:HeroName>Captain America</tem:HeroName> <tem:RealName>Steven Rogers</tem:RealName> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Mask</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Cape</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Flies</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>SuperStrength</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <Description>He was a skinnny little man with buckets of courage I think. . . Its been a while since i watched the movie and i wasn't paying to much attention to the starting. Anyhow they made some sort of machine that gave him instant muscles without the roids chin. Now I'm not too sure how super he is, I mean he is stronger then most people and has a fancy shield. But when watching a movie he seems to change his abilities. At one point he is fighting a normal man and just manages to beat him but then later on he is fighting some supervillian and just manages to beat him ??? Maybe that is part of his super powers, to be just a little better then everyone he fights. I'm not sure if it is part of his back story but the whole flying into the ice thing at the end of the first movie was um . . . Lame.</Description> </tem:GetHeroDetails> </tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>

con:response.name: Flash
con:response.con:responseContent: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:tem="http://tempuri.org/"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> <!--Optional:--> <tem:GetHeroDetails> <tem:HeroName>Flash</tem:HeroName> <tem:RealName>Barry Allen</tem:RealName> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Mask</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Cape</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Flies</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>SuperStrength</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <Description>So here is something confusing, don't get Flash mixed up with Marvels Flash Thompson. One is a super fast super hero the other is a dude that was good at running and bullied peter parker until they grew up and became friends. After spending 30 minutes reading about his origins, he never developed any powers at all. So the real flash wasn't just one person, there were four people that developed flash like symptoms from things such as being struck by lightening and something about chemical lightening . . . weird. And the tv series on at the moment looks ridiculous. I have only seen about 4 minutes of the program but that four minutes is enough to reassure me that my judgment is correct. Seeing flash running at super high speed only to stop infront of the bad guy and attempt to punch him in normal speed mode made me want to watch something else and i did.</Description> </tem:GetHeroDetails> </tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>

con:response.name: Batman
con:response.con:responseContent: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:tem="http://tempuri.org/"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> <!--Optional:--> <tem:GetHeroDetails> <tem:HeroName>Batman</tem:HeroName> <tem:RealName>Bruce Wayne</tem:RealName> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Mask</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Cape</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Flies</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>SuperStrength</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <Description>He was a rich kid, his parents were killed in front of him when getting mugged. So he spent some of his billions on turning himself into a superhero in a bat costume. While he doesn't have super powers he has an array of gadgets and vehicles at his disposal for delivering his own justice to the evil doers of Gotham City. Oh and he is Batman...</Description> </tem:GetHeroDetails> </tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>

con:response.name: DareDevil
con:response.con:responseContent: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:tem="http://tempuri.org/"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> <!--Optional:--> <tem:GetHeroDetails> <tem:HeroName>DareDevil</tem:HeroName> <tem:RealName>Matthew Michael Murdock</tem:RealName> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Mask</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Cape</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Flies</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>SuperStrength</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <Description>He was a blind kid and because of his blindness he had heightened senses. Well thats the info I had gathered from watching that awful awful Ben Affleck movie so many years ago. After two seconds of research turns out he had some sort of radioactive substance fall on him from a passing vehicle. It was this that blinded him but gave him his heightened senses.</Description> </tem:GetHeroDetails> </tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>

con:response.name: Incredible Hulk
con:response.con:responseContent: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:tem="http://tempuri.org/"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> <!--Optional:--> <tem:GetHeroDetails> <tem:HeroName>Incredible Hulk</tem:HeroName> <tem:RealName>Robert Bruce Banner</tem:RealName> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Mask</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Cape</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>Flies</tem:Type> <tem:Value>false</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <tem:Attribute> <tem:Type>SuperStrength</tem:Type> <tem:Value>true</tem:Value> </tem:Attribute> <Description>Caught in a blast of Gamma radiation he become a Jenkyll and Hyde character. Nice guy Banner when he was calm But when he was angered he would turn into a green super strong monster of little intelligence and consumed with rage. Randomly going from crazy distructo monster he was able to control himself as the hulk in the avengers movie with no explaination given...</Description> </tem:GetHeroDetails> </tem:GetHeroDetailsResponse> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>
